intro: Albuca weberlingiorum, commonly known as the Weberling's albuca, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
